pullRequest.body:
Co-authored-by: Jujian Zhang <jujian.zhang1998@outlook.com>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [ddb95acbdd](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17789/commits/ddb95acbddbfbf5f15be90b6ed25a2f0886d8dd4)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Central.Matrix`|916|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ TensorProduct.eq_repr_basis_left`
`+ TensorProduct.eq_repr_basis_right`
`+ TensorProduct.sum_tmul_basis_left_eq_zero`
`+ TensorProduct.sum_tmul_basis_left_injective`
`+ TensorProduct.sum_tmul_basis_right_eq_zero`
`+ TensorProduct.sum_tmul_basis_right_injective`
`+ matrix`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

:v: Whysoserioushah can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Let's not merge before the following comment is resolved
> I don't think you need any hypotheses on B at all. If C is free then B tensor C is just B tensor (finsupp I R) which is finsupp I B and now injectivity is immediate. This probably shortens the proof too.

Thanks!

bors d+

Thanks for the PR! It looks good to me modulo a few comments, but an algebraist will need to approve as well

maintainer merge

Thanks for the PR! It looks good to me modulo a few comments, but an algebraist will need to approve as well

maintainer merge

Thanks!

bors d+
This docstring is in some sense worse than no docstring, you can get more information by just reading the statement of the theorem.
hmmm okay deleted

All the previous results were in a section and used completely different variables. The point of sections is to control the scope of variables. Probably you should have let the section end here and started a new one if you had no interest in the variables already set up. Note also that all your lemmas have variables `{Î¹C Î¹B: Type*} (ð’ž : Basis Î¹C K C) (â„¬ : Basis Î¹B K B)` so perhaps they should also be variables in your new section.
good point I've adapted the original variable names now

This statement looks quite weird. The assumption that B has a basis is not used in the statement and is not necessary in the proof; indeed all that one needs is that iC spans C as a K-vector space. Then one can write x=sum_i b_i (x) c_i, one writes each c_i in terms of the spanning set and tidies up. No hypotheses on B are necessary at all. It also feels like the most natural statement would be with a finsupp Î¹C â†’_0 B.
Ah okay but I thought we need both basis for Basis.tensorproduct?

In `TensorProduct.eq_repr_basis_right`, I used another proof avoiding `Basis.tensorProduct`; however in `TensorProduct.sum_tmul_basis_right_eq_zero`, I have to assume `M` is Free so that I can use `Basis.tensorProduct`

K is commutative so surely you can just deduce this from the previous lemma via [`Algebra.TensorProduct.comm`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/TensorProduct/Basic.html#Algebra.TensorProduct.comm) rather than going through the long proof again.
done

This is probably more nicely expressed as a map from finsupp being injective. In fact it seems to just be the statement that if Î¹C is K-linearly independent in C then it's B-linearly independent in B (x) C when B is free. It feels like this should be true more generally. What's the correct statement here?
I assumed `B` is free, not sure what is the correct generality though

I don't think you need any hypotheses on B at all. If C is free then B tensor C is just B tensor (finsupp I R) which is finsupp I B and now injectivity is immediate. This probably shortens the proof too.
Should this be in a new file?
I think if this is in a new file, then the `large-import` part should be okay
Can you prove the more general statement that `Matrix \iota \iota D` is central when `D` is central
I have moved it

```suggestion
```

Thanks for the PR!

We don't usually put the space after the copyright header
```suggestion
```

```suggestion
/-!
# The matrix algebra is a central algebra
-/
```

`where` notation lets you introduce variables before the `:=`
```suggestion
  out m h := by
```

```suggestion
/-- Elements in `M âŠ— N` can be represented by sum of elements in `M` tensor elements of basis of
`N`. -/
```
Same here
thanks, applied

```suggestion
    âˆƒ b : Îº â†’â‚€ M, b.sum (fun i m => m âŠ—â‚œ ð’ž i) = x := by
```
is possibly clearer
Why have this section given that there is only result in it?
indeed

```suggestion
          congr! with j h
```
same everywhere else

```suggestion
    use (ð’ž.repr n).mapRange (fun (r : R) â†¦ r â€¢ m) (by simp)
```
The `.|>` trick is nice but in my opinion makes things harder to read.

Similarly elsewhere.
Changed thanks

pullRequest.title: feat: more on central simple algebras
